definition: to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...

sentences.english: So I really feel that I owe them a lot.
sentences.chinese: 所以我真的觉得亏欠粉丝们很多。

sentences.english: Maybe you can never tell that love is correct or wrong, and there is no one owing to the other.
sentences.chinese: 也许，爱情从来没分对与错，也没有谁亏欠谁。

sentences.english: This is a betrayal of what we owe our servicemen and women.
sentences.chinese: 这也是我们对军中服役的他和她的亏欠。

sentences.english: Her mother lost her job a long time ago and has always felt that she is indebted to her current husband.
sentences.chinese: 她妈妈很久以前就失业了，总觉得亏欠现在的丈夫。

sentences.english: You have been weighed on the scales (of God) and found wanting.
sentences.chinese: 你被秤在天平里，显出你的亏欠。

definition: to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to be ashamed to face (sb)/to feel bad about having failed (sb)
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
